channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Litter outside property, 9th February
item.description:
Someone has dumped all this rubbish for over a week and has left a foul smell and untidiness.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Grand Union Crescent, Hackney, London

item.title: Pot hole/Drain cover damage, 9th February
item.description:
This damage has been here for a few weeks. It's as you enter into Hunsdon Estate (Fluke House side). It's right near the car entrance.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Brooke Road, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Paving outside 9-11 Hollycroft Ave NW3 7QG, 9th February
item.description:
Follow up on Ref 8853126. Please extend scheduled yellow signage to include works around this tree with dislodged paving stones. Today, you responded to my previous requests on this with "no further action". Please review your plans, as we urgently want the dangerous paving stones rectified with tarmac to prevent recurrence. my previous messages included all relevant photos etc. This is not an anonymous request. From the original request in Jan 2025, it has been from Jonathan Silver at No. 9 Hollycroft Ave
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Hollycroft Avenue, West Hampstead, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Incomplete pavement works on grange road, between crimscott street and pages walk., 9th February
item.description:

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Grange Road, Old Kent Road, Greater London

item.title: 30"x24" Pothole outside 9 Padua Rd., 9th February
item.description:

Incidentally there are more developing potholes adjacent to these repairs which were carried out in January 26. This problem is also different from the report currently shown it's a different location.

item.title: Dangerous large road repair fault, 9th February
item.description:
There is a large mound in the tarmac in the road here. It is about a metre by a metre, almost in the shape of a small traffic calming bump with sharper faces. But its unmarked and unpainted so is not a calming measure. The "repair" done by this contractor was a lazy and inadequete job, endangering cyclists. I know this is there now (for the last few months) but when I first hit it, I fell off and could have been seriously hurt.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Clements Lane, City of London
Report on FixMyStreet
